definition: ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: Now the first bolt of lightning stabs the earth. It is heaven's exclamation point3.
sentences.chinese: 这时，第一道闪电刺向大地，这是天国的惊叹号。

sentences.english: tagline should perhaps have been a question mark instead.
sentences.chinese: 这句标语后面的感叹号或许应被一个问号所替代。

sentences.english: In addition, an exclamation point is often used as an iconographic symbol to express importance.
sentences.chinese: 此外，感叹号也经常被用作表达重要性的图形化符号。

sentences.english: As with many programming languages, an exclamation mark means not.
sentences.chinese: 和许多编程语言一样，可以用一个惊叹号表示“非”。

sentences.english: That’s why so many of these posts end in a question mark, not an exclamation point.
sentences.chinese: 这也是为什么大多数文章的结尾都是问号而非感叹号。

sentences.english: Her status updates were bubbly shrieks of uppercase letters and exclamation points.
sentences.chinese: 她的状态更新总是以大写的字母和感叹号出现。

sentences.english: The exclamation point methods modify the string which invokes the method.
sentences.chinese: 而带有感叹号的方法直接修改调用它们的字符串。

sentences.english: For reason below, I would call this the Tang's exclamation mark method.
sentences.chinese: 我这个方法或可称为邓氏感叹号法。

sentences.english: An exclamatory sentence should be followed by an exclamation mark.
sentences.chinese: 感叹句的结尾应该使用叹号。

definition: Chinese underdot (punct. used for emphasis, sim. to Western italics)
dash/Chinese dash ── (punct., double the length of the western dash)
Chinese back-sloping comma 、 (punct. used to separate items in a list)
blank/blank space on a form/space/囗 (indicating missing or illegible character)
